intro: Dichanthelium neuranthum, commonly known as the narrowleaf panicgrass, is a grass species native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and flowering stems that are often丛生 (clumped). Dichanthelium neuranthum is often found in wetland ecosystems and is an important component of the local flora.
